sentence.text: Native Americans build special types of homes.
Some homes are made from ice, some from trees, some from animal skins.
All of these homes help people solve important problems.
First, homes protect people from rain, wind, cold, and wild animals.
Second, homes provide a place for family and community events.
Learning about different types of homes helps us to learn about people from around the country.
The Navajo People live in Arizona and New Mexico.
Many Navajos live in modern houses, but nearby they often have a hogan used for ceremonies.
Sometimes the hogan is round, sometimes square, and sometimes it is an octagon with eight sides.
The Navajo People live in Arizona and New Mexico.
Many Navajos live in modern houses, but nearby they often have a hogan used for ceremonies.
Sometimes the hogan is round, sometimes square, and sometimes it is an octagon with eight sides.
The frame of a hogan is made from tree branches.
The spaces between the branches are filled with mud.
Instead of a door, sometimes the entryway is covered with a blanket to keep the wind and cold out.
The sun rises in the east.
The entryway faces east to receive the morning light.

The entryway faces east to receive the morning light.
Inside, a blanket is hung from the middle of the ceiling to create two rooms.
The men always sit on the left, and the women sit on the right.
Thus, hogans provide Navajo people with shelter and places for important family events.

The Inuit people, who live in cold parts of the world, make igloos.
An igloo is a type of house made with snow.
To build an igloo, the Inuit people use a shovel to make a circle in the snow.

The Sioux people lived on The Great Plains, a flat area of North America.
Many Sioux still live there.
In the past, they rode horses to chase buffalo.
The Sioux hunted buffalo with bows and arrows (tap the arrow).
The Sioux ate the buffalo meat, and they made clothing out of buffalo skin and fur.

The Algonquians are Native Americans who lived in the northeast region of North America.
The Algonquians built special homes called wigwams, which were made from tree branches and bark.
First, an Algonquian cleared the land of stones and branches.
He moved the stone into a pile.

The Haida people live on islands in the Pacific Northwest of North America.
The Haidas are famous for carving totem poles.

The Seminole people lived in log houses in Florida.
The Seminole people lived in log houses in Florida.
But in 1830, the U.S. Army took over their land and the Seminoles fled into swamps called the Everglades.

Because the Everglades are very wet, the Seminoles could not build houses on the ground.
Instead, they invented the chickee, a house built above the ground.

Then he tied long poles between the stilts.
